7. You are driving in the far right lane of a four lane freeway and notice broken white lines on the left side of your lane. You are driving:
column6: in a special lane for slow moving vehicles.

column2: 8. Parking is not allowed:
column4: on the road side of a parked vehicle.

column4: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column6: Traffic must move only in the direction of the arrow

column2: 12. When driving in fog, you should never use your high beams because:
column4: the light will reflect back into your eyes.
column6: vehicles behind you may follow too closely.
column8: oncoming vehicles might not see you.

column2: 13. When changing lanes, drivers should never:
column4: check to see if other drivers are moving into the same lane.
column8: glance over their shoulder to check for blind spots.

column2: 14. What does the flashing signal in the picture indicate?
column4: The same thing as a stop sign.
column6: Pedestrians should finish crossing the street if started.
column8: Pedestrians should start crossing the street.

column2: 15. This road sign means the road you're driving on:
column4: turns sharply to the left and then right
column6: turns to the right and then the left

19. This road sign means:
20. There is no crosswalk and a pedestrian is crossing your lane ahead. You should:
column4: stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing the street.
column6: slow down as you pass the pedestrian.
column8: make eye contact and then pass the pedestrian.

column2: 21. A flashing yellow light means:
column4: The light will soon change from green to red.
column8: Yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.

column2: 22. When you hear the warning signal or see the warning lamps of an emergency vehicle, you must:
column4: drive slowly until the emergency vehicle has passed.
column6: stop as quickly as you can.
column8: provide a clear path for the emergency vehicle and stop.

column2: 23. What does a flashing red light mean?
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.
column8: Drivers may move forward with caution.

column2: 24. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
26. This sign means:
column4: A road crosses the main highway ahead.
column6: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column8: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 27. This road sign means:
28. This sign warns of a ________ ahead.
29. If you become sleepy while driving you should:
column4: get some rest or change drivers.

column2: 30. When a hazard is seen ahead, reaction distance:
column4: is the sum of perception distance and braking distance.
column6: equals total stopping distance minus perception distance.
column8: is how far a vehicle will continue to travel, in ideal conditions, before the driver hits the brakes.

column2: 31. Aggressive driving behaviors can include:
32. To maintain an adequate "space cushion" to the front, drivers need to:
column4: keep a safe distance between their car and the vehicle in front.
column6: The other answers are both correct.
column8: control their speed to suit the road and traffic conditions.

column2: 33. When you see this sign you should:
column4: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.
column6: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.
column8: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.

column2: 34. Having a drivers license is:
35. An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
column4: The driver can legally pass red lights.
column6: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.
column8: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.

column2: 36. When you are facing a green light and there are pedestrians in the intersection:
column4: you must signal your intention to cross the intersection at least 100 feet before yielding the right-of-way.
column6: you must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians.
column8: you have the right-of-way over pedestrians.

column2: 37. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must make a left turn at the intersection.
column6: they must not make a right turn.

column2: 38. You are approaching an intersection with a traffic signal indicating a steady yellow light. If you have not already entered the intersection, you should:
column4: speed up to cross the intersection before the light turns red.
column6: slow down and proceed with caution through the intersection.
column8: stop before entering the intersection if it is safe to do so.
